etymologies: Middle English: from Latin resident- ‘remaining’, from the verb residere (see reside)

definitions: a person who lives somewhere permanently or on a long-term basis

examples.text: it was a beautiful hamlet with just 100 residents

shortDefinitions: person who lives somewhere permanently or on long-term basis

definitions: a bird, butterfly, or other animal of a species that does not migrate

examples.text: arctic residents are joined annually by long-distance migrants

shortDefinitions: bird, butterfly, or other animal of species that does not migrate

definitions: a person who boards at a boarding school.
shortDefinitions: pupil who boards at boarding school

definitions: a British government agent in any semi-independent state, especially the Governor General's agent at the court of an Indian state.
shortDefinitions: British government agent in any semi-independent state

definitions: a medical graduate engaged in specialized practice under supervision in a hospital.
shortDefinitions: medical graduate engaged in specialized practice under supervision in hospital

definitions: living somewhere on a long-term basis

examples.text: he has been resident in Brazil for a long time

definitions: having quarters on the premises of one's work
shortDefinitions: having quarters on premises of one's work

definitions: attached to and working regularly for a particular institution

examples.text: the film studio needed a resident historian

shortDefinitions: attached to and working regularly for particular institution

definitions: (of a bird, butterfly, or other animal) nonmigratory; remaining in an area throughout the year.
(of a computer program, file, etc.) immediately available in computer memory, rather than having to be loaded from elsewhere.
shortDefinitions: (of computer program, file, etc.) immediately available in computer memory
